TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CompletedEventArgs extends System.Management.ManagementEventArgs

Docs.summary: Holds event data for the event.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example calls a method asynchronously. The **Win32_Process.Create** method is called to create a new process for Calc.exe.
[!code-csharp[wminet_CompletedEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_CompletedEventArgs/cs/CompletedEventArgs.cs#1)] [!code-vb[wminet_CompletedEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_CompletedEventArgs/vb/CompletedEventArgs.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Status As ManagementStatus
public: property System::Management::ManagementStatus Status { System::Management::ManagementStatus get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the completion status of the operation.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that indicates the completion status of the operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A <xref:System.Management.ManagementStatus> value indicating the status of the operation.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StatusObject As ManagementBaseObject
public: property System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ StatusObject { System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets additional status information within a WMI object. This may be .
Docs.value: Additional status information about the completion of an operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `null` if an error did not occur. Otherwise, may be non-null if the provider supports extended error information.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
